I checked in around 6pm, took around 1hr++ I booked superior king room, however was told all rooms are full, they gave me 2 bedroom suite instead, with no other additional charge ( i was lucky).. the suite quite big, complete with kitchen, dining area, living room.. worth for big family, however it not well maintained- some of lamps not functioning, water heater in master bedroom not functioning.. floor also got dirty stains.. staffs were very polite, i made complaints n they entertained me well.. good job.. overall, worth the money..

i am sorry to say this room very dirty got stain of some spicy things on carpet and blanket very dirty the room door look like oldage i hope they change the broken things n keep it clean. THE LIFT LOOK LIKE HAUNTED LIFT EVER 😔TQ
good and nice

After check in, in my bedroom still have rubbish from previous client which is empty bottle vitagen, coffee spill at table, and the bed a bit dusty and musty smell. So i hope the management can solve this problem for the next client and improve your services to be more better in future. Thank you. 😊

many hidden charges like parking , not give use facility like rooftop must fill up form ....not assist correctly....staff not doing thier job properly many get orders from managment...not suggest this Hotel to others...This is 1st & last time check in REGALIA SUITES & HOTEL...thats all from me

pictures show balcony had coffe table and chairs but upon reaching theres non and i feel disappointed since i book that room because we want to chill at the balcony. second , towel they provide got holes 😞 . we paid the hotel include with the breakfast , they provide the same menu for my second and third day , plus they serve cold tea . at TEH TARIK PLACE stated we can order room service before 7.30pm by call from the phone room but no one answers and we call hotel direct and ask but the reception said we need to go buy our own and this is so confusing cause at the Teh Tarik Place their stated u can dial 0 for room service . we stay for 3day and 2 night ... we not gonna comeback again . and the facility need to booked one day before and its always full lol ... and we dont have chance to swim at the swimming pool .

This will be my first and last. First, the room was not made properly eventhough we check in after 3pm. The toilet seat were sticky and the room were untidy. Upon check in, the staff didn’t even update our amended booking and asked to pay full amount in cash eventhough i’ve made my payment through the apps. Whats the point of paying in advance when suddenly I have to pay the full amount at the property?? I’m so mad about this. I advice agoda to remove this property from your listings and just rate this stay as a half star property. Because of the bad room condition, I had to check out early and stay in another hotel.
All dust inside nd floor has so many paint, tv was not worrying bedsheets was very dirty over all won't come back there
very nice
if im late but staff is very kind . nice view and the best place to rest 💟

reviews.review_title: The room is not as expected. ”
reviews.review_comment: Not value for money, booked for 2 premier suite, no facilities provided in room, dining table only have 2chairs instead. No internet access and the phone is not working as well. Basic kithen and table ware were not provided. Not recommanded to stay for family for young children.

At first I got the 38th floor which is the highest level of the hotel. There is only one elevator that can be used to go to the level and it didn't work at my time of staying there. End up i ask for a different room at the lower level that they can give. The hustle of getting the elevator to reach the previous level is very problematic. And there is no parking ticket. I had RM29.00 deducted from my TnG.
It's ok to stay because of the location. Not really and enjoyable place to stay.
Breakfast at 9am! Too late. Waste my money as meeting start at 8am

Bayar breakfast for 20 per person tp dpt nasi lemak je. I thought buffet style. & servis very slow. Call room servis pun susah angkat. Nak tukar time booking pool pun kene turun kt lobby dulu. Leceh sbb nak tunggu lift pun slow. Should improve & mudahkan customer
I COMING BUT ROOM NOT READY. STAFF ASK ME FOR WAIT 3HOUR MORE TO GET ROOM. SO U THINK?
Elevator - not properly maintained, need to wait for quite some time for the elevator to arrive. Not all elevator seems functioning / properly maintained.
1. Noisy 2. Bathroom pipe broken 3. Floor broken

It's was a little troublesome for us as we had to change rooms thrice. The first room we got had aircond (not cold) and bathroom pipe broken issue. Then, we had to wait for some time before they changed our room. When we got to the second room, we only managed to put out bags and left for a dinner reception. As we came back.. boom! Aircond issue again and they couldn't do anything about it because no maintenance guy was available. So, we slept in our not so cold room. The next day, they upgrade our room to a better one, yet it was not so. However, the aircond was good to go. So, we just oversee the minor issues with the bathroom (sink pipe was loose, divider sliding mirror was not really sliding, too small toilet sitting area). Also, parking was also charged upon using Touch and Go which many other hotel and suites don't do. We didn't know that before booking. We spent RM 1.60 per hour. Total we spent additional RM60 just for parking. So, I don't think, I will be staying here again and hopefully the management would check their rooms facilities so others would not have to got through the same thing.
the place is not well maintained
no good

reviews.review_title: POOR COMMUNICATION SKILL BY STAFF, RUDE STAFF”
reviews.review_comment: 1. Dont book here, cleanliness out. There is stain on the bed and carpet, even their balcony very dirty. 2. Their receptionist staff, super rude. Need to go for training. Ms Farah, Ms Alisha/Elisha/Aisyah (sounds like this), omg, you guys very rude. Please go for training.

Need to add more staff. I waiting to check in from 2pm till 8pm waiting the room ready. every thing went well.

Recommended to stay ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Will repeat again

nice infinity poll

registration takes a long time. the room was unsatisfactory and there was a slight odor. long waiting time for breakfast. overall was unsatisfactory.

THE HOLIDAY BECOME STRESS DAY! NO TV- AIRCOND NOT COLD, CANT ENJOY THE POOL!!! DAMN USELESS HOTEL!!! WORST HOTEL EVER!!!!!

Everything is very good ...

reviews.review_title: Accused of smoking in the room 15minutes after i checked in. ”
reviews.review_comment: I left and checked out from this hotel 30minutes after checking in. Will never ever stay and recommended this particular establishment ever. I left to check in a 3 Star Hotel nearby, needless to say it only took them 3minutes to check me in and gave me a smoking room. Better bigger room and superb service right from even opening the main entrance door for customers. I called the so called Hilton Garden Inn 8 times through their main desk but no one answered. The 2 times someone answered - he redirect me to reservation but no one answered and ending with a machine voice. Long story but will write it to its head office for APAC region. The supervisor is rude on the intercom to my room and even more rude when he came to threaten me with a mere RM250 fine if i am caught smoking. Will be looking at avenue to teach this staff a lesson in service anytime but with a surprise.

reviews.review_title: parking is not enough for guest, too hard to looking for parking”
reviews.review_comment: KL area, but is not easy to find for car parking, we need over night 2days, there is not enough parking for guest, and another problem is no restaurant or mamak nearby for supper, just only rooftop sky dining until 11pm, no choice for other food

1. Room was lovely - a little bit dusty but lovely nevertheless. Slept like a baby that had wayy to much cough mixture (in other words- really well!!!) 2. Staff was polite and friendly 3. I took a grab so I had no issues with parking but if you have a car it might be tough to find parking ? Unsure. Its a busy area. 4. The rooftop deck was a truly pleasant surprise. Amazing view. 5. Only complaint would be- I was really enjoying the view and ambience of the rooftop bar/lounge but I was denied alcohol! A cold beer would have made it perfect. Why? Cause there was a Private event for a Pre- Buka Puasa shoot. I mean it was a huge open space, I would have been very happy sipping my beer in a tiny corner and would have gladly left upon the arrival of guests. (I wanted to order one hour before the event started). I mean at least inform guests during check in there is a private event. But honestly, I had a really pleasant stay.

reviews.review_title: Personal Review from One Night Stay ”
reviews.review_comment: Stayed one night Pros: (1) check in & check out process was fast (depends on number of guests) (2) near to restaurants (3) reasonably good basic amenities provided (4) shower has very good water pressure (5) parking a plenty (free during my stay as it was on weekend) (6) air conditioner worked well (7) feel safe and secure (8) front office staff was helpful (9) beds, pillows and sheets were all acceptably clean Cons: (1) quite noisy at night (noises from restaurants nearby and people moving things) (2) soundproofing of my room was bad. we could hear people talking from next room (not sure about other room) (3) should improved soundproofing (4) should should provide a mirror in room (5) TV channel quite limited..this is disappointing if you are a TV fan (6) higher room rate if you walk in - advisable to use booking app (7) view from my room was not a pleasant (not sure about other rooms) Verdict: quite value for money for a budget hotel

reviews.review_title: One of The Best Places Ever”
reviews.review_comment: Everything was perfect about this place. Rooms: Extremely clean and comfortable rooms with a quaint yet updated traditional look and feel. I very much enjoyed the bath tub available in the rooms - soaked all my stress away. Facilities: Pretty limited to just a gym, swimming pool and a spa. F&B: Breakfast delivered to the room - quite pricey but the quality of food and beverages were excellent. Service: Hotel staff service was on point - one such example of the excellent service was when I was at the pool swimming and forgot to bring a towel with me. Without even requesting and much to my surprise, two bath towels were brought to my lounge chair. Cons: My one small disappointment I experienced was regarding the flexible check-out time (which was not accommodated) everyone I knew talked about. Would've been great if I could enjoy the facilities a little bit longer. Overall, great accommodation. Will come back if the prices were more reasonable.
good

reviews.review_title: Good location, value for money, nice breakfast food”
reviews.review_comment: RuMa Hotel is one of the pricier establishments out there, but you get what you pay for (not sure if you feel the same paying full price without Agoda or direct website promos) with an excellent breakfast (they adhere to SOPs), complementary minibar and water, Nespresso machine and spacious room. It is also located in-between KLCC and Pavilion - not near enough where you can wear 5-inch heels to walk or while carrying 2 suitcases, but near enough to not get drenched in sweat (the walk is sort of uphill). My only suggestions for improvement are to have a mix of thick and thin pillows as I find the overly thin pillows uncomfortable, and the lack of tissues (housekeeping missed this out because the tissue box is inside the drawer and they didn't realise it's finishing - understandable as I don't expect them to stick their hands inside seeing as COVID is still rampant, but perhaps have 2 tissue boxes? One for the living room and one for the bathroom?). Other than these I'm pleased with my stay and would recommend others to stay here again - I would come again myself but I would need to save up for it / wait for a special occasion).
One of the best 5 stars hotel in town. Very attentive staff and we enjoyed our stay so much

reviews.review_title: The room is clean and comfortable”
reviews.review_comment: The room is clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly

Glad to say after 2 years away The RuMa still has that special feel and charm. Gracious and friendly staff. Special mention to Kak Rozita for her warm welcome!! Well thought out design giving it that tranquil ambience. If only they brought back 24 hour check in and check out it will make even more perfect....😁
Everything was perfect! Will visit again
nice service , nice room

It was a birthday staycation for my fiancé and I. Hotel free upgraded us to grand king room, decorated with balloons & prepared a birthday dessert for my fiancé. Staffs are very welcoming, everything was worth the price.
very noise can hear next room sound and outside corridor walk way people walk around and door close sound .

reviews.review_title: Everything was good except the view”
reviews.review_comment: Good experience except the breakfast is mediocre.
late checkout give up 2pm for me to pray zuhur breakfast at Atas Nice n so lovely room inside give junkfood
I like the design of the hotel room very much, it is very comfortable and feels like home, I can stay in the room all day and don't want to go out hahaha
Positive comments from check-in until check out, no que for check-in, the staff come to you for check-in, no stress. Room is very cosy and comfortable, value for money! Facilities are also best!
Good service and clean！
Location, decoration, everything about hotel is termendous
only issue is the price, but we got it during promo at half price so problem solved!
I would like to say The RuMa Hotel is one of the best hotel. The hospitality presented for us was really good. Everything runs smoothly for me and my husband. Would definitely come here again.
great
Nice room with great breakfast!
The "senior looking staff" mustn't take off his mask especially talking and mixing drinks without a mask.
top notch service by the staff.really helpful on guiding us to stroll around KL.room deco really beautiful. But the breakfast menu was limited and tasteless
1st time stay here and for sure I will be back again soon. Well-done The Ruma. Keep it up the service quality.
except AC is warm
Great attention to detail on interior and service

I had the best view of the whole KLCC scape! Staff were extremely frendly and welcoming despite the New year's eve crowd. Room is extremely clean, a very good location for a staycation, everything touristy can be walking distance
Love the hostmanship concept. Staffs were friendly and they call you by name, surely different from other hotels i've been to. .
One of the best hotels I’ve stayed so far, staffs are friendly, room is super clean, we enjoy our stay very much. Will come back again!
Totally recommended. Modern contemporary concepts really cool.
Helpful staff, very clean and modern design, strategic location.

The interior design is very nice. Room is very comfortable too. Walking distance to Pavilion. The staff are very polite and friendly too. Only complain I have is the check in process took about 30 minutes and I had to pass my credit card + IC to them without supervision. At one point i saw my card and IC was left on the counter without anyone looking after it. Regardless, we had an enjoyable stay.
From check-in to late checkout, overall 100% smoother, and I never forget for breakfast- they serve the best cheese in the world 🌎 - you should try guys
Good ID & room condition. Hotel environment also interesting

reviews.review_title: Great couple staycation. Right at the city center”
reviews.review_comment: Fantastic room and services. Food was alright but if your are ordering room service, I recommend the coconut dessert.
Very comfort and clean

reviews.review_title: Probably the best hotel in Kuala Lumpur”
reviews.review_comment: Everything was fantastic, from the concierge to the room and it’s wonderful facilities. The hotel and its rooms has a Balinese feel to it. Everything was great. However, tried to reach the concierge and the room service via the in house phone but it was not reachable until I called using my own private phone. Got to improve on that, otherwise, flawless stay
We enjoyed our stay! The place with privacy
Thank you Kiki for your hospitality. Thank you to reservation team for arranging the decoration and cake in my room. For ATAS eatery staff for your service during my birthday dinner.
Indeed it’s home away from home with a contemporary living in mind, great room amenities and friendly staff. This is my go-to staycation hotel in KL. 😊
the hotel is more suitable for business trips instead for families with younger children. there is a sky bridge to KLCC & Pavilion., just a 5 to 10 mins walk.
Lots of complimentary given by the hotel. Very comfy bed and all around good

Had a night stay with my hub & kids. The hotel is very beautiful with Christmas settings, nice bed and bathtub. We had wonderful breakfast at ATAS restaurant. All the staff in hotel is polite and pool staff is helpful to show me the lift button to the restaurant. Everything is perfect, the only thing is the room bidet is leaking water and I forgotten to inform the hotel staff. Mayb they can check into it. Thanks for the hospitality, keep it up!
Breakfast have to be improved
Loving the vibes, breakfast and the room is sparkling clean!
Great location, walking distance to Pavillion and KLCC. Room is nice and comfortable especially the mattress. Breakfast choice not much but taste good.
Totally pleased with the exceptional room, service and experience. Will definitely visit again soon!
Stayed here for one night with my wife and kids. Overall very satisfying

Came here for my birthday staycation in October 2021 and the staff so kind to decorate the room with balloons and complimentary cake. Totally enjoyed our stay in The Ruma KL. The room so high tech and the blinds come down automatically as we enter. Love the interior design of this hotel and the staffs outfit are amazing! Excellent hotel with great customer services.
Superb hotel location. Friendly staffs The check in process was fast. clean hotel room with city view.
Definitely recommended, such a warming 5star hotel.
Deserved five star and I experienced it. I wanna repeat here. Hope they always give the best service
Thank you so much for the amazing hospitality and the quality of service and facilities! Fully recommended if you want to experience a hotel that is just amazing overall!
Attentive staff, room cleanliness is good , location perfect , May be facilities wise not enough! Highly recommended to those business travelers need to stay In CBD KL .

I would like to express my gratitude to all the Ruma’s staff. They are so friendly and helpful. One of the staff help us to get the babycot and prayer mat without waiting for us to request for it. Everything was perfect!

Too crowded during weekends. Pool is full in the morning and afternoon. Breakfast can get congested, but the food is fine. Room is good, amenities are fine, complementary mini bar is very appreciated. If you're looking for peace and quiet and serenity in the city, this is not it.
Definitely worth it kinda place! But not a fan of crowded pool area as they had event at the pool area.

My husband and I had our mini honeymoon here, and everything about the stay was lovely! Their rooms have bathtubs for a good soak, and basically everything you'd need for a comfortable stay. Breakfast was nice, and you can request for breakfast-in-bed too. Walking distance to Pavilion, and parking is FOC with validation.

Had the opportunity to stay a night at their Deluxe King room. Loved the decor of the whole place, very traditional rustic like. Loved that the bathtub faces the window with a view altho can't appreciate much at night. Only thing is the food, nt very impressed with their breakfast spread altho their eggs Benedict are good. The rest are just so-so and unfortunately there's room for improvement for their waitress (needed to prompt a few times to get things done). Overall, good stay. Would I come back again? Definitely.

The room is spacious, bed, pillow are comfy, toiletries are perfect. Another added point is able to mirror my iPhone to the TV, we can watch drama, video thru the tv. A little tips on the toiletries, if you couldn’t find it, they are located at the left drawer, when you pull it out, you might not see it, because it might stuck inside. We spent sometimes to find it.
Worth every penny. Walking distance to Pavillion & KLCC. Room is unique, clean and look new.

reviews.review_title: One of the best hotel ever stayed”
reviews.review_comment: The hotel’s location is walking distance to most of the major city attractions like KLCC, Pavilion Mall, Starhill and Jalan P.Ramlee. Hotel have parking and free when you validate at the lobby. Our breakfast was served in the room during weekdays. The pool is amazing overlooking the city. Can also smoke cigar at pool bar. We didn’t try the restaurants but I’m sure it’s excellent because we saw lots of occupied tables. The room is the one where it will make you not want to leave this place. Complete with full amenities, robes, slippers, Nespresso machine, etc. The beverages in the minibar were provided for guests staying more then 2 nights. The bed and pillows are comfortable but a bit soft for my wife and I. The whole design and aesthetic of the place is very well thought off. The service given by the hotel staffs in The RuMa is impeccable especially the housekeeping and room service people.

I booked the hotel one day before checkin. In the morning call the hotel if they can setup like a decoration for my anniversary and they said can. I also booked spa slot for my wife. Arrived around 5pm and need to wait a bit. Frontdesk staffs quite busy and a little in stress mood i think. Not really friendly. Is oky. Later when up to my room and i saw no decoration like i asked them to do. Go check at frontdesk and they said no note or remark under myname. Nevermind. Then i ordered room service, popcorn chicken and club sandwich. Popcorn chicken taste like yucky.But club sandwich nice. Breakfast ordered chicken soup wantan and also chicken taste yucky. Then i think overall, not value for money. Just my two cents. But my wife enjoy the spa a lot.

Would like to thank the staff who is so thoughtful to the guest. Room was so clean and bed is too comfortable for me to even want to leave! Breakfast in room is on point too and so worth the money and stay.
Nice staycation for my family! walking distance to KLCC & Pavillion. Friendly staff!
This hotel super cosy, efficient staff & all the food was good

Overall a good decent hotel, staff was very good . Breakfast in my opinion could have been a lot better with more variety. We couldn’t use the swimming people , because it was crowded , I suggest to have an alternative pool (maybe charge an amount , so that it would be more private ) . Overall I give this a 4/5 star .
Staff friendly ! Is a good vacation

even during mco. the staycation and facilities were in the great condition. the beauty of the lobby and the grand staircase, with the complimentary mini bar inside my room, all 5 star. you can even request for early check in and very late check out. i love this hotel so much. definitely will come again!
nice for stay

What a luxury stay and relax time after a controlled becoz of covid19.... Well, only one thing do wish upgrade on it. The breakfast time, their staff would busy get order from each table and miss send those food by ordering. And KItchen unable to get fast in order to.match the customer order. Not a good way for practise morning schedule. By the way, the food was really nice. I love it just wait a long time and did not get my wonton soup

I really like the ambience of the lobby, the rooms. It gives a different feeling with the interior. The room also gives the cozy upper class local house feeling with the wood interior. All the lighting, the toilet, the doors, the fan. Not like other hotel. The staff also very helpful in explaining.
Very nice design and atas hotel although slightly pricey. The swimming pool is quite crowded and no time slot reservation is required.
best hotel ever
Happy to stay in hotel, nice environment! Defiantly will come back again
Just want to say, overall fantastic..and you all need to try this hotel!!!!🤩🤩🤩✨✨✨

So far , the only hotel that has flexi check in and check out, free mini bar. Excellent service. Good and nice staff. Mr khairul, if i'm not mistaken, he is very good and very helpful person. Want to repeat again!!!😁
I had an amazing experience here! Everything was great!

Very peaceful, relax & comfort eventhough the hotel in the middle of the city. The Hotel management was followed the SOP very strictly while still maintaining the friendly welcoming attitude to its customer very well. Just to query for the room dine-in menu, the portion of the food was not much as I was expected for this luxury hotel. Other than that, all perfect.

reviews.review_title: One of the best hotel in Kuala Lumpur”
reviews.review_comment: The staff and their service is nice, the room is nice and clean, and the breakfast is not too bad also, overall 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Average Joe Hotel with a ridiculous price!”
reviews.review_comment: The room is quite spacious and nicely decorated. It comes with a few cans of carbonated drinks as compliments. Here we go into details on the downside list of the hotel: bed was not up to my preference.. unlike most of 5 stars hotel in KL, where the quality of the bed is simply the best! Here at Ruma ? Not even a word could i describe how awful the bed is! One of the hotel staff at the breakfast section should be fired asap!. Bias against local or average looking family. No need for me to explain further. Overall, an unpleasant stay and not worthy for the amount of money that ive paid.
Staff were friendly and amenities were great. Comfortable weekend getaway.
The hotel totally beyond my expectation and definitely will stay again. Room service is perfect.

The property is within walking distance of KLCC. The lobby is posh and gives a sense of exclusivity. The layout of the room is very creative. The highlight is the bed - comfort level beyond imagination. Bath and shower with strong water pressure.

Had my 10th anniversary staycation here and got free upgrade in room. Love the design and cleanliness of the hotel. Upon checking in, they already know my name and served me with drinks and detailed explanation. The breakfast included were superb. The service is excellent! Love the flexible check in and out time and the minibar! Location wise is just 8 mins walk to pavilion and 5 mins walk to klcc park. In conclusion, everything is perfect!

I chose to stay at RuMa during MCO since business sector is open for public. Since our staycation is during MCO, no facilities at RuMa is open for guest. But there's in-room dining where you can choose from 1 out of 3 breakfast set from vege to Malaysian meal set. I've got 2 set of free breakfast since i chose for Free Breakfast package in Agoda. For me eventhough no facilities is open, the location of RuMa itself is good where you can walk to nearest mall (either to Pavillion or KLCC). Bonus point for RuMa is you can have flexi check-in and check out. You have to confirm with the reservation office at least 24 hour before your arrival date if you want to come as early at 1am or to check-out as late as 11pm. Definitely we will come back to RuMa after MCO is over, for us to try facilities offered such as gym, swimming pool and spa :)

reviews.review_title: Superb Hotel, Superb Services, Top Notch HOtel”
reviews.review_comment: Top Notch Hotel & Service. Excellent Amenities. Great experience right from check-in to check-out. No complains!! Keep up the excellent job The RUMA folks!! Will definitely return & absolutely recommended to everyone.
The service attitude is good, the environment and equipment are great too, I would like to come again.

hotels.name: Oasia Suites Kuala Lumpur by Far East Hospitality
hotels.address: No 10, Lorong P Ramlee, KLCC, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 50250

reviews.review_comment: Highly recommended. From a huge space to lounge, with two TVs, a dining area and open concept from kitchen to room, the space was thoughtfully created. The interior was gorgeous and purposeful, I give A+++.The bathroom was gorgeous,with wood feature from top to bottom, the addition of a rain shower made it even more exciting. Only issue was we found a cockroach, probably need a better drain trap and some areas like in the iron cupboard was dusty. The single beds were quite tiny, I'm not very big and I had hardly much room-I should have opted for the king.Beddings were top notch. Would be great if you could provide dishwashing liquid with a sponge so we can wash up since there is a kitchenette as well as a broom for tidying up spills. Also we were disappointed that the pool area was closed at night, we would have loved to get some pictures of the view which is the main reason we chose oasia-as we were given a lower floor Overall, one of the best stays.
Best place for staycation.. All facilities tiptop.. Just a bit tricky to find a way before arrive.

My overall stay was good except for the parking..when it run out of the token/card, i press the intercom but no one come n i dont think their intercom are functioning.. due to that i need to reverse which give me trouble n go and report to the receptionist by my own!
Best hotel ever

The hotel seems to be run by 1 person - the receptionist/cashier/conciege. Did not see another staff. No food at all. Everything is closed. Absolutely no information about the hotel in the room. Suite is small, poorly maintained. Please throw away the grubby rag. First thing that caught my eye. Shower is good. Air-conditioning, no complaint.
The hotel is clean and facilities are well maintained. Only the carpark space is quite small where is a bit hard to navigate. Can see many scratch mark around the wall.

Oasia Suites Kuala Lumpur have a spacious room, bed comfortable, water pressure in the bathroom is very strong and good for shower and the air conditioner in the room is cold. However, the Wifi signal is always off and on disappear, The hotel location is not so good, it is far walk to Bukit Bintang, Jalan Alor and KLCC. The hotel is good for relax during the week end rest. I will stay again if the hotel rates is affordable.

The area was just to crowd with cars park blatantly by the roadside. Might not really suitable for those who travel by group with bigger MPVs because the parking space was just too cramped All 4 booked rooms was just fine and spacious, could be better in term of cleanliness

reviews.review_title: Best staycation in the heart of KL”
reviews.review_comment: Spacious room, complete facilities, value for money
This is one of the best place to stay in so far. Ample facilities and comfortable. The only problem is the super small car park area.
Value of money
The room was big and convenient, The Room was provided with washing machine + dryer which can be used all day ><,

reviews.review_title: Good and worth for the price”
reviews.review_comment: Good promotion price for a 1 bedroom unit. Definately will come back again
I always came back to this hotel. It suits my family, huge, smells good The problem is bathroom always caused water spilled out, rough towels

1 night stay , 1 bedroom premier. Love the room so much. Facing the KL tower. Clean and cosy room. Front desk staff helpful and friendly. Hotel location easy access to other area. Will stay here again in future.
Best all the facility n room but just lif aje slow .. i think 10minit wait for lif but other then that all is good 👍👍👍
Nice facility Good location Nice room Value for money
Located in City nearby walking distance to KLCC & Pavilion. Room is big enough with most of necessity. Hotel parking a bit narrow if you are driving your own.
The tap water is blocked and the environment seen in the picture is different

reviews.review_title: Far from the city but still in the city”
reviews.review_comment: Located in the city but still offers silence and calmness. The staff was friendly and easy to communicate with. Lots of near restaurants as well. The only downside that I can think of is the way to the parking is quite narrow. Just be careful. The rest is fine!

reviews.review_title: Great location but cleanliness need to improve”
reviews.review_comment: First room we got, one of the free bottled water was opened and drank by someone else. The bathroom walls were stained and the floor was sticky to step on. Second room we changed, bathroom wall was again stained. The cleanliness of the hotel is needed to buck up. Hair dryer was broken. Air con was somewhat noisy. Heater was not hot enough and the sound insulation was pretty badly done. Location wise is great. At the heart of KL city, convenient to move around. Amenities were great too. Overall border line experience for the price.
Room ok and good for family trip

relaxing getaway, Good facilities. Good for longer stay with Washer and Dryer. Beautiful pool with nice scenery overlooking KL Tower. Location wise heart of KL , less than 10 mins drive to Ikea Cheras.

If you’re a couple looking for a getaway this is the best place for you to come. Very friendly staff, good service. Too bad i didn’t get any good view with my room but the room is absolutely perfect. Might come here again next time in KL. Worth my money. 💯

reviews.review_title: Nice place for a quick getaway”
reviews.review_comment: Book a 1-Bedroom Premier for a quick getaway for the weekends. The property is a bit old, but very well kept. Bedroom was huge, with beautiful view of Menara Kuala Lumpur. Toiletries, WIFI and other basic kitchen utensils are provided. Will repeat if they remain the price tag.
This hotel is really nice and clean. Except the location. I love everything about this hotel! Will come again soon!

Everything is good. I’m a happy customer. Just that maybe the parking part can make it easy or other way need to be found as you need to verify your card every time you go out. ‘‘Twas it was a good stay

Good hotel with affordable price in the middle of kl city. However the drive up parking area is so small and narrow , you may feel stressed driving up the building. They provide utensils, cooking necessities , fridge and stove, toiletries, hairdryer . Really good. Dryer was abit complicated to use and there’s only 2 lift which is quite slow especially during checkout times.

reviews.review_title: Nice place except the parking lot ”
reviews.review_comment: The place is nice and strategic but the parking lot is small and its route is narrow which is a bit inconvenient unless you don't mind to park outside.
Oasia Suites KL is a great hotel and really worth the value of money.

The room is overlooking KL tower and Loji Air Bukit Nanas. Frankly, I almost cancel this room and look for other accommodation, but, I didn't have time to do another round of survey since time was too short. Fortunately, it's a good bargain. Love the unit. Spacious. Clean. Amazing view. If the weather is good, you can even walk to KLCC!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thanks Oasia Suite for a nice stay over the weekend.
Staying here to celebrate my 2 years old boy and my eldest 6 yr old son. The room was big enough for 4 of us. Really like the room concept, kitchen at the front & the room at the end of it.

Not a place I recommend. Dirty bed linen; TV channel selection very poor and signal loss in bad weather Shower-Rain head not been cleaned in years so water goes in all directions Not all lifts working Dark corridors Noisy/old aircon

The last time I was here (Feb), the whole team/place was so great made me book another stay (in the same month!). The hospitality was great. The room was spacious, CLEAN and I just love how the room was filled with sunlight during the day. I swear they have a top-tier treatment for their guests and that's among the reason why I choose to stay here again. I love how every place is just a walking-distance. Most of the time I just stayed in the room because it was too cozy and relaxing. To Oasia team, you guys are amazing. Will come again, soon!
Very nice hotel , book again next week visit KL
Everything went smoothly! Room is very clean and equipped :) staff were nice; parking might be a little tight but it’s bearable
nothing
Recommend for your travel
Very fresh enviroment in the center of KL
The room was spectacular,clean and updated.really love this room.the staff was very friendly.really help me a lot.definitely will come again.

Stayed here for 3D2N in the cheapest room, free parking as I drove my own car, just need to validate the parking card at receptionist before exiting the premise. No bathrobes provided like stated in the amenities. Some of the wallpapers are torn apart in the room and hallway. AC placement in my room are a bit inconvenient as it’s place right above the dining table so the food gets cold easily. Unfriendly staff but helpful tho.

1) late check in for an hour 2) asked to wait and come back later 3) the quilt was super dusty and had pillow feathers 4) changed a room 5) tv have no battery 6) floor just clean and little wet Very unpleasant stay

Loved the size of the room. Parents and children could have their own private space making it a wonderful holiday. Walking distance to KLCC. A lot of amenities around. Parking space a bit narrow. Overall, enjoyed the stay.

My kids very enjoyed the pool and I can’t stop to take photos with the background view (kl tower) . The room just nice but maybe can add some light in bedroom . Its a bit dark when at night. Otherwise all are good. Staff also friendly. Thanks oasia!

The room is big and there’s dining place in the room where we can eat in the room without having to worry about the smell of the food goes into the room. The parking lots are quite compact. If you’re driving big car you have to be extra careful.
Room is big and clean. Giving you feel a luxury stay. Will definitely come back
Stayed with my husband for a short staycation. Really clean room with big tv. Comfortable through and through. Will stay here again for sure!

Location is a bit inside even though its located within Golden Triangle , not safe for a solo traveller to walk at night , the road was narrow and surrounded by clubs. Rooms are spacious ,overall quality was average but could be done better
Location are quite nice and easy access in the middle of Kuala Lumpur!
Nice

We got KL Tower and KL view. Very spacious room with living room, dining area for 6 pax, complete kitchenette with microwave, washing machine with dryer. The only weakness was the parking area. Very narrow lane to go up and down from the parking area.

I didnt expect the place to be exactly like the picture the moment I stepped in. I was so happy that the place looks EXACTLY like how they advertise. Worth it. Very clean. Very comfortable for WFH. Spacious. The staffs were great! I requested sugar packets around 10pm/11pm, they sent it to me 5 hours later, which I have told them not to because I've been informed of littl manpower. They were just great HOWEVER! The parking space is just too narrow. I survived tho makes me feel like I can rule the world now haha.
Was good. Worth It!
Clean and tidy, good location and surround with fodo n convenient store.

It's an old hotel and it shows. The elevators are running a bit slow. Room is rather spacious even though it looks worn out. Facilities are decent. Location is quite a challenge to find. Parking is also rather confusing and limited. Staffs are excellent. Very friendly and helpful.
what a best place for stay one night..
Disappointed to see the sour face of the staff throughout the stay.

We stay for 3 Days 2 Night. Arrive around 3PM and check in were smooth. But when enter room seems room is not well prepared. Inform to reception & they gladly upgrade our room to 2 Bed Room. Room are really spacious and we enjoy our stay here.
The location is a bit at the back of the main road..and it's kind of far if u were to walk to KL Tower. Had to pay more to get a better room
Clean tidy hygienic place.. the place smell refreshing.. Very comfortable staying here.
Even i check in late night, the fronttier counter upgrade my booking from deluxe to Premium suites! Good Suites for those who need to stay 1 night or long terms staying !
Staf yang sangat bagus..Swimming pool pon sangat best..View KL Tower.. Aircond sejuk dan hotel yang sangat luas…Will repeat again to stay here next time…

Good choice for family, value for money, very big room and clean.. perfect choice to celebrate a birthday party. We booked 1 unit of 2 Bedroom Premier and 2 units of 1 Bedroom Premier to accommodate 11 of us.. comfortable bed, its nice smell from the lobby, its clean and a lot of comfort items to make you feel at home. Easy access to pool and our kids love it so much. Highly Recommended!

The hotel provides all the facilities you need. I love the washing machine. Not many hotel has this facilty. Pool is facing KL tower which is great. Need to book slot for pool but everyone will be able to enjoy the pool according to the timeslot. Overall, im satisfied!
First time stay sini. Best sangat. Dapat bilik betul-betul depan KL Tower… pool pun best!! View KL tower! Bilik besar! Boleh masak-masak dengan family. Will come again!
Good location nearby KLCC
environment very good,clean n comfortable
Good place to stay for a week
Spent 2 nights on 2 different rooms, i'm very happy happy with everything. Definitely my choice whenever I come to KL. Recommended!!
Loving the design. Huge master bedroom. Easy parking, got xmas freegift from hotel. Oasia is a must repeat

The room look old and lack maintance. Can see obvious stain on the wall. The bathroom rain shower is broken and not funtioning properly. The shopoo holder looks like it gonna fall off soon. The bed is not clean. Can see the old stain and some heir when look close up. Tv is not clear to view, serious noise. Overall old hotel lack maintance. Not worth Rm200++ a day. The good thing is roof top swimming pool, have washing machine in the room.
Will come again
Worth every single penny. Clean, spacious, all the amenities in the room was on point. Definitely will comeback.
Superb hospitality as well as follow the SOP of pandemic covid19 very well esp at swimming pool. Clean room n spacious too. The staff also doing their job well. Thank you
Everything is good but please the lift is too slow 😵‍💫
Parking limited. Check in process was okay. Apartment completed with basic need. Overall cleanliness was okay but during check in, one of the toilet contain unflushes feces. Gross!
definitely suitable for family & friendly staff

This is my second time here, always lovable experience. I really appreciate their staffs, so friendly and listen to their customers need. Everything here is perfect. The view, the cleanliness, all good. I will always stay here everytime i go to KL. Thank you oasia staff.
Overall ok. Just the lift only one function. Need to repair another one because waiting very long.
Value for money

reviews.review_title: Will come again...has small kitchenette...good for family.d hotel even have cooking appliances”
reviews.review_comment: For those who have kids.. highly recommended

Nice hotel with welcoming drinks and sweet treats for kids upon arrival on new year eve. However a bit disappointed, it was a rainy day on the first day n kids unable to swim. Others and SOP are great.
Good Service

It was my first time staying at Oasia Suites with my friends and it has become our favourite hotel in KL. The room with spectacular view of the KL Tower, friendly and attentive staffs. Overall, we've had the most amazing experience staying at Oasia Suites. Will definitely stay here again in the future.
Overall everything was perfect for our anniversary celebration..our 2 year old son also enjoy the room so much..
Friendly staff..

reviews.review_title: Great location, clean and spacious suite.”
reviews.review_comment: Safe for kids to play and run around the suite. Friendly staff, smooth check in and out.
Very slow check-in system due lack of cleaner. Should have limit no of rooms open during peak
Got room with menara kl view. my son love it. recommended. spacious room.
Place is nice and clean.
Very good. Highly recommended.
Very convenient around this condo

There was left over food in front of the lift, and also there was outside the room. People at the opposite room put their leftover outside and it stayed there for way too long it started to smell. At this point it was roughly 19 hour long but luckily it was time for me to check out (I was really curious to see how long it would still be there).

On the second day when I request to tidy my room, the receptionist told me that I will be charged RM90 for the service. I thought all hotels provide this service? Only staying 3 nights and above will be given free of charge. Sound not right. They provide mineral water for free upon request. Overall, good stay.

Only thing they do not have much eating place nearby except for their coffee house which you have to walk quite far ( not recommended for the elders ) and Dome plus a couple of restaurants ( one of them is not halal can't remember which one ) downstairs . Not recommended for the elders who have trouble walking far. Okay for families who don't mind to walk a bit further to find other alternative eating places.

On 1st housekeeping day (3rd day), Housekeeping provided only 1 toilet roll, no kitchen floor mat, 2 small bottles of drinking water, no extra hand towels despite having told Housekeeping on day of check-in, and left a note and tip to Housekeeping on Day 3. 3) For living room, 1 switch for all lights. So either switch on all, or switch off all. At night while watching videos, it was too bright to have living room lights on. Had to switch on balcony light as living room light off.
Very convenient for shopping & food just walk through from hotel lobby. Hotel rooms clean, especially toilet & bathroom. I definitely will come back again for my next trip.

There was no ironing board, no bath rug, no slippers, etc as I was staying for more than 2 weeks. 3) Was told that half the staff were laid off.

It was new year's eve and we spent more than an hour to find a parking spot. The basement parking was full and cars were even double parked. Finally we parked at the lobby entrance. Saw a signboard that the basement parking is a public parking. Still, hotel management should have reserved sufficient parking bays for their guests.

Checked in to this hotel after the hotel we booked earlier has been closed. Cheaper than the hotel we booked, and it is near to KLCC! Very convenient too. No breakfast available but you’re staying next to Avenue K, there are lots of restaurants and cafes. Staff are friendly too!

Located in front of the klcc, just across the street. In the centre of Kuala Lumpur. The room is suitable for family and children. It is quite big! Easy to get around. Just make sure to not bring big luggages as you will be using the stairs from the parking lot.
Good location. Walking distance to KLCC

I and my family spent Christmas holiday in KL, so I've requested for connecting room to reservation manager about 2 weeks before of our stay. Then, positive answer or ever simple acknowledge was not given at all. Upon check in, I told about my request again, reception staff said it's reservation team's responsibility. If I know inter connecting rooms were not given to us, I could book another better hotel. Anyhow location was good. Room is small though.
Rooms is awesome! This my second time check in at this hotel, overall is good!
Convenience & Room is clean
Best location, the guard was attentive and assistive. Room was good and view was fantastic.
Clean, walking distance to klcc and avenue k. But limited parking spaces, need to go earlier .

The location of the hotel is superb. So convenient with walking distance to the subway station. Just the cleanliness need to improve as I can spot some furniture are dusty especially when you out from the lift. The decoration furniture are dusty and also the cabinet are near the TV they are layered with dust.
Just improve if u guys can put some hot shower
Bad environment , low capacity of parking . the hotel room was not clean at all. dusty, dirty there are cockroaches running around. Please do something about cleanness .

This hotel is recommended because its a walking distance from klcc and near to.lrt station..However,can only view klcc from only 1 tower.No facilities provided only towels and amneties.Room quite amall maybe can fit 2 people only.If you are looking for a room to just sleep this hotel is ok .
The staff at the hotel registration name Khai was so ggod n facilitating us during our stay..the hotel also was clean
The best hotel near KLCC with reasonable price. Easy parking and just walking distance to KLCC
Nice to stroll along the mainroad. Near restaurants, malls, foodtrucks at night. Awesome
Sgt selesa..

reviews.review_title: Got different room for a different booking”
reviews.review_comment: I really wished I had been given for what I asked for or more than that what I paid for. As a family with two young kids , the offer was 1 queen bed and 1 single bed. What i got was 3 single beds, and to my surprise the hotel staff just informed me its full occupancy. i m wondered as though i walk in there to book a room. its a pre order thing. i've paid for my booking earlier so this should not be the issue. I wont recommend this Hotel to others. tq
ok

I booked for for room with king size bed and bath tub (as advertised in the option), but I received without the bathtub. When we rang the reception, she said that all room do not have bathtub. How can it is available on the room option & advertisement then?
we stay because it is very near to klcc even our room can see the klcc very good place to stay if you want to wander around klcc

reviews.review_title: sound of running water, bathroom lamp & kettle”
reviews.review_comment: Got sound of running water whole day even staying at top floor. Suddenly bathroom lamp off 2nd day, Kettle spoilt totally.
We were not expecting to have a room like the one we were staying in. Complete facilities and with an awesome view of the Twin Tower.

Consider a good hotel. Great location very close to the KLCC. Very helpful staff. Satisfied with the cleanliness. No breakfast provided upon my visit maybe due to pandemic
Best location ever for budget travellers. Service is good. Only setback we have to pay rm5 per entry for parking. Overall its a good place to stay.

Nice

reviews.review_title: Near to Suria KLCC and Twin Tower”
reviews.review_comment: place is nice nearby and not too crowded easy to take grab and convenient

5minutes walk to KLCC .. book for 3nights + extend 1 night… the room is so nice & not big.. my husband and my daughter can sleep well.. the air conditioner cool.. room cleaning by mr norman very clean and tidy.. the staff very helpful such as they validate my card to get parking for only rm5 perday and the parking lot very secure.. no need worry to park car..but use touch n go card ok..we shopping at KLCC everydays and we need affordable price hotel.. de king is one of my favourite hotel.. if u need anything just ask their staff very nice& helpful!
Television not working, but internet is good, so boleh lah cover kesunyian malam.
It is walking distance to KLCC. You also can go shopping at Avenue K just infront of the hotel.

I booked room with KLCC view! So nice and very cheap. I got 138 pernight with klcc view. Staff receptionist very humble and easy going. The smells of the room is very calming. But the tv channel is not good.
Good location and will come again
Great stay in place to explore Kuala Lumpur. Value for money

First of all, I like how the staffs accommodates their guests. They offered something to drink while waiting for your room to be available. The room was simple clean and oh I like the bed. I slept well. The room was well ventilated. It was really great. Worth the money, and the location is perfect because its near to resto, mall and etc. Everything are great in it. Although, I suggest that the bathroom needs more enhancements it looks creepy, wifi not so strong because I experienced choppy line while I was in a meeting virtually. And lastly, the signage of the name of the hotel must bigger. It was not visible, some guests cant see it. But overall, it was an amazing hotel to stay if you are in a tight budget. 😉

Strategic location, near with Avenue K and KLCC, about 5 - 10 minutes walk distance to KLCC. At ground floor have 7eleven which is good. But for me to bring my husband and my kids to this hotel again, I'm think not, because from GF they have 3 lifts but only 1 can use, inside lift look so dark. Until i reach at reception counter. So dark and creepy. Receptionist was okay. Room access card only give 1 no, which is not conveniently because when my husband went to GF to buy snacks, he needs access card to use at elevator. The corridor, omg so dark. My daughter keeps crying because she's afraid of the dark. Inside hotel's room which is i choose view of KLCC, also cannot see clearly because of windows conditions. Im not expecting any more for 3 star hotel but compare to another hotel that also 3 star, i am speechless. It is so scary and not feeling comfortable, i only check in at 9pm, checkout at 11pm on the same day. I'm rather to spend more money for my daughter instead of let my kid spend whole night crying because of not comfortable. Toilets? My husband said like 70s design like slate stone at waterfalls or something. First and last.
just walk distance to klcc

reviews.review_title: Go to place for a short staycation”
reviews.review_comment: It was a short staycation on weekend. It was a nice place to stay since it's near KLCC, literally 5 mins walk only. We had our night walk there. Easy access for public transport as well since it's right i front of the main road.

reviews.review_title: kicked out of hotel, half way through the stay”
reviews.review_comment: Guest was asked to leave... as they were CLOSING Due to MCO...

I didn't get to stay this time as the hotel shut down on my day of arrival due to MCO. No prior notice from the management, nor any messages after that, which is somewhat unprofessional but to be expected in those strange times... I'd still recommend the place for having stayed there before, it's very close to KLCC, there's a couple of MTR stations nearby, the rooms are fine, the staff is friendly, etc. Just not my luck that day.
Nice convenient place. Can’t go wrong
okla
Just next To Avenue K and KLCC. Walking distance.
Good hotel, near to klcc :) more important is very clean. cleaning services is very good for me. And hotel price is awesome, i got this with promo budget price :) !
suitable for couple nice and relax

reviews.review_title: Clean, Simple but a bit dark”
reviews.review_comment: Stayed for 1 N recently due to strategic location. My 2nd time. Still clean as 2 years before although it was Le Apple Boutique then. Room was pretty dark at night with only lights near bed. Basic toiletries. May I request for a pair of slippers to be included in all rooms. Another snag is no lifts from carpark to lobby hence hotel shd inform guests to drop luggage at the front first before parking otherwise it's a long flight of stairs to lug them all up. Otherwise it's a very decent hotel at a strategic location.
Wish they would provide free parking
Good
Overall stay at this hotel is very satisfied. Only thing the hotel management could upgrade the aircorn quality in the room.

During booking it was stated tat its a king sized bed bt it was queen size. Parking was hussle coz vry limited parking lots with too many cars, glad that the guard helped us. Ter oso stated tat parking per day is Rm5 bt its per entry!!!! cleanliness i would give 3 stars.. neway manageable for 1 nite stay, not more than tat!!!!

hotels.name: Cititel Mid Valley Hotel
hotels.address: Lingkaran Syed Putra, Mid Valley / Bangsar, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, 59200

reviews.review_comment: GOOD 1. Clean - room, bed & toilet 2. Convenient - just beside Mid Valley Megamall 3. Parking - Neat & a lot of parking. Free also for guest 4. Lift - pleanty & fast too 5. No deposit BAD 1. Housekeeping - not everyday. Every 2 days only 2. Breakfast - no buffet breakfast. Need to order a limited choice but its ok la. Definitely recommended & will come again.
Have to pay RM5/ entry of car parking fees

Overall I can say the best hotel I ever stay but the hotel should review on the upgrading rate which I have encountered. For my opinion, the hotel shouldn't charge for upgrading room that high ( more then 60% of the booking room).

Cititel Mid Valley is always the best hotel during my visit to Kuala Lumpur. Sadly my recent stay everything went wrong. Toilet not working (cannot flush & leaking) & water heater also not functioning. The room carpet was full of choc stains. I was offered room exchanged but the new room was filled with the smell of cigarette smoke as if before this the previous guest smoking in the room and yet the room is non smoking room located on the non smoking floor. Cititel was known to be the cleanest hotel during my past visits. The hotel management must look into it seriously. Overall, the staff are very helpful and friendly not to forget the maintenance staff. I do really hope that these unpleasant things would not happen again during my next visit.
good
good

reviews.review_title: Very nice for shopping and looking for food.”
reviews.review_comment: nice hotel.

Always be my favourite hotel because my kids just love this hotel. Very helpful staff and recommended for everyone. In addition my family and i felt so comfortable with the hotel changes “new one” after renovation. Will come again ☺️ surely!
clean
Plenty of hairs on the carpet. Some guests didn’t respect the house rule as a non smoking hotel. Van smell the smoke. Can also listen to people chatting from the other rooms.

I chose this hotel due to the location as I was on a shopping trip. Nothing beats the convenience of going down the lift and having the mall steps away from the lobby. The room is really nice and clean though a bit on the small side. The best part for me is the water pressure in the shower. If I have any negative point to share, it would be the lack of free parking spaces. I'm fine paying RM15 per entry for parking as I was only staying one night and I spent my time shopping. But if I have other plans which need me to travel to and fro in the future, I will not be staying here.
Duduk sini sebab senang nak pergi midvalley. Hehe

reviews.review_title: One of the best hotel in Kuala Lumpur”

We had to book 3 nights at Cititel due to a power cut at our condo, so we thought we would sleep comfortably in a hotel for 3 nights.
